intro: Tephrosia siamensis, commonly known as Siam tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet being ovate to elliptic in shape. Tephrosia siamensis produces yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom during the rainy season.
